name: International Association of Oil & Gas Producers
legal: A company limited by guarantee. Registered in England, No. 1832064
membership: EEF, CEPS, EPC, FRIENDS OF EUROPE, The Kangaroo Group
goal:
IOGP is the single association representing companies and associations engaged in the exploration and production of oil and natural gas both at global and at EU level, with offices in London, Brussels and Houston.

At EU level, IOGP represents members who are active in Europe. IOGP Brussels office participates in the European Offshore Advisory Group (EUOAG), the Madrid European Gas Regulatory Forum as well as other consultative groups set up by the European Commission, and it is the prime interlocutor for energy policy, environmental and other issues related to this industry.

Globally, IOGP’s worldwide membership produces 40% of the world's oil and gas. IOGP fosters cooperation in the area of health, safety and the environment, operations and engineering, and represents the industry before international organisations, such as the UN, IMO and the World Bank, as well as regional seas conventions, such as OSPAR, where it has observer status.

Vision:

To work on behalf of the world’s oil & gas producing companies to promote safe, responsible and sustainable exploration and production.

Mission:

To be the forum of choice for our members' companies to exchange views, data, information between themselves on any topic that is being discussed in Brussels and that could have an impact on Exploration&Production activities.

To facilitate continuous improvement in Health, Safety and the Environment (HSE), Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), engineering and operations

To liaise with other industry associations globally and provide a forum for sharing experiences, debating emerging issues and establishing common ground to promote co-operation, consistency and effectiveness

To represent the interests of oil & gas producing companies to international regulators and legislative bodies including the EU institutions.

Objectives:

To improve the collection, analysis and dissemination of data on HSE performance between our Members

To develop and disseminate within our industry best practice in HSE, engineering and operations

To promote CSR awareness and best practiceTo improve understanding of our industry by being visible, accessible and a reliable source of information

To represent and advocate industry views by developing effective proposals
